comment.body:
@Mynameislegion: Here's a link I found: http://127.0.0.1:43110/domains4free.bit/?Post:2:Free+Bit+Domains

and: https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/#how-can-i-register-a-bit-domain
Here's a dark version of ZeroMe, I don't think it's official though. http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HmJ7GadjdiQUPevaK7QXVrK4nhyCp1fSj/

>Does ZeroNet use Bitcoin's blockchain?
> 
> No, ZeroNet only uses the cryptography of Bitcoin for site addresses and content
> signing/verification. The users identification is also based on Bitcoin's BIP32 format.

> Namecoin's blockchain is being used for domain registrations.
from https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/#does-zeronet-use-bitcoins-blockchain

@FraYoshi: It's the regex pattern in a content.json file I think. change the astrisk `*` to `.*` in one of these files. `*` without the dot `.` isn't allowed anymore in regexes in 0.5.7. I believe this is the problem.

> **Disallow potentially unsafe regular expressions to avoid ReDoS [Reported by MuxZeroNet]**
> To avoid possible attacks the `.` character is became mandatory before the repetition characters `*,+,{` and maximum 9 repetition allowed in **content.json** and **dbschema.json** files regex patterns.
[/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:114:New+version:+0.5.7](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:114:New+version:+0.5.7)

Couldn't he just create code that will go through every file already uploaded, create piecemaps, change the database, etc. and then sign with his private key for each of the user `content.json` files.

You should have deleted it *on the site* because uploading files adds stuff to the database (description, title, etc). Deleting the file yourself won't remove the information from the database, but doing it from the site will.
@Flyman: That's odd - must be a bug then (as in either not deleting properly, *or* deleting the database info wasn't implemented either now or at the time kopy jane cloned ZeroUp)
@Flyman: Unless maybe it doesn't delete it in case there are other people who currently are seeding the file?

I don't know how similar this is to Tab Groups, but there's the Firefox Containers addon which was from the Test Pilot, but "graduated" to an add-on because of the great reception (according to [this blog post](https://medium.com/firefox-test-pilot/firefox-containers-are-go-ed2e3533b6e3)). It works on FF Quantum. You can get it [here](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/multi-account-containers/).
@Jayofthezero: That's a good point. Didn't something like Tab Groups used to be in firefox itself without an addon, like a while ago? I remember there being that same icon that Tab Groups uses.
The right is the peer count for ZeroProxy, not ZeroHello; unless I'm misunderstanding what you are saying.
@Herp: Just so you know, this isn't Nofish. Don't worry, I was confused at first as well.
